#Copied from Rukshan  Mr Rauf Hakeem could have discussed this matter with the higher officials and come to a solution . Now, because of his post some Muslims might hide the symptoms. He is indirectly saying if you have these symptoms don't come then you won't be able follow the religous customs  If the family members of the deceased had come to claim the body, it could have been buried. But none of them did because they have been quarantined at the moment. He could have looked in to the matter as a community leader on the day it self. He didn't do that as well. Instead of asking the muslim community to come forward if they have symptoms he is blaming the authorities for this. whining on Janaza in social media will lead the country into a communal distress. Suspected Muslims won't comeout and hide and spread corona more and more among themselves. Other communities will reject to contact muslims on the fear of corona. This will hardly hit on poor muslim vendors and families.

Mr Hakim,  Mind you, that the 1st victim whose body was cremated on the other day was not even given the due respect and due religious rituals as ordained in his faith as well. This is a Pandemic. Your faith would play no drama with the Corona Virus. And I would say, the plight is the same with any other faith too. So, please do not try to be smart amongst your people and try to get political advantage. Stay home. Take care of yourself from the virus. Thank You.
